DataElement.preferredName: EGFR T790M Mutation Biopsy Present Post EFGR TKI Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study related to biopsy existence of genetic alterations of EGFR T790M after EGFR TKI progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: EGFR NP_005219.2:p.T790M Mutation Biopsy Present Post Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 790 in the epidermal growth factor receptor protein where threonine has been replaced by methionine._Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Any tyrosine kinase inhibitor that targets the activity of the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) tyrosine kinase. Inhibition of epidermal growth factor receptor tyrosine kinase may inhibit the growth of epidermal-lineage tumor cells, especially those that overexpress epidermal growth factor receptor._advancement in extent or severity._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 790 in the epidermal growth factor receptor protein where threonine has been replaced by methionine.:Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Concepts.definition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 790 in the epidermal growth factor receptor protein where threonine has been replaced by methionine.
Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Property.preferredName: Biopsy Present Post Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Any tyrosine kinase inhibitor that targets the activity of the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) tyrosine kinase. Inhibition of epidermal growth factor receptor tyrosine kinase may inhibit the growth of epidermal-lineage tumor cells, especially those that overexpress epidermal growth factor receptor.:advancement in extent or severity.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Concepts.longName: Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor
Concepts.definition: Any agent that inhibits the activity of the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) tyrosine kinase.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is EGFR T790M mutation presen
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is EGFR T790M mutation present from biopsy (or plasma if performed in a CLIA-certified laboratory) from any site of disease (intra- or extra-cranial) after progression on a first- or second-generation EGFR TKI?
